arts.ttl: Frank Lampard makes Coventry City admission as verdict delivered on victory over Preston
arts.sum: Frank Lampard agreed that Coventry City's 2-1 victory over Preston North End was one of the most pleasing performances since he’s been at the club. First half goals from Jack Rudoni and Bobby Thomas crowned a dominant first half at the CBS Arena where the Sky Blues should really have put the result to bed with more goals from several chances before the visitors pulled one back eight minutes from time to make for a nervous end to the game.

arts.ttl: Lampard's in-form Coventry maintain play-off charge
arts.sum: Coventry made it three consecutive wins with a 2-1 victory over Preston.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings v Preston as Sky Blues finally break the North End hoodoo - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Rudoni gave City - who hadn't beaten North End in the league since 2007 - a deserved lead on the half hour when he headed into the top corner from an Ephron Mason-Clark cross from the left after an impressive spell of pressure from the home side who dominated the opening half against the Lilywhites. North End made three changes at the break, including bringing on striker Emil Riis, but Tatsuhiro Sakamoto almost made it 3-0 on the hour when his swerving shot from the edge of the 18-yard box was palmed away by Freddie Woodman, who made a brilliant save to his right, leaving Mason-Clark unable to convert the loose ball.

arts.ttl: Coventry continue winning run with victory over Preston
arts.sum: Jack Rudoni and Bobby Thomas scored in the first half for the Sky Blues.

arts.ttl: Coventry City v Preston North End live updates and team news from the CBS Arena
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Coventry City head into today's CBS Arena game with Preston North End looking for their first home win over the Lilywhites in the league since 2007.

arts.ttl: Ferguson, Ronaldo and Lampard - Jamie Paterson's incredible journey to Coventry City - CoventryLive
arts.sum: “Walsall was a feeder club for Man Utd at the time so all the players scouted for Man Utd from the Midlands used to train there a couple of nights a week and then we’d go on pre-season tours and things and play games. “I was trying to get a team and my mum saw a sign on the wall at Walsgrave Asda saying players were wanted for Pinley, in the middle of Wyken/Henley Green area, so I went to train with them and had a few games there,” he said.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard wary of 'googly' with Coventry City cavalry in view
arts.sum: Asked if he’s already thinking ahead in terms of starting line-ups and fitting everyone in when the likes of Wright is back to full fitness, Lampard said: “I have and I think about it before every game, depending on us and who’s fit and on how we have trained. Frank Lampard has revealed he’s already looking three or four games ahead to see what his Coventry City team might look like on paper, at least.

arts.ttl: Fadz backs 'old school' Coventry City defender in his own image to step up amid Frank Lampard advice
arts.sum: The 37-year-old centre-half delighted the travelling Sky Blue Army last weekend when he joined them in the away end at Hillsborough and, being a life-long Sheffield United fan, thoroughly enjoyed Ellis Simms’ stoppage time winner over the Blades’ arch rivals. arts.ttl: Frank Lampard to make calls on Haji Wright and Ben Sheaf ahead of Preston
arts.sum: Asked about Wright, who has been out with an ankle injury for three-and-a-half months, the City boss said: “Yeah, he’s going well and he’s certainly turned his corner now and his training with us. arts.ttl: ‘Serious credit’ – Coventry City vs Preston North End prediction: The72
arts.sum: The72's writers offer their Coventry City vs Preston North End prediction ahead of the Championship clash on Saturday. The post ‘Serious credit’ – Coventry City vs Preston North End prediction: The72 appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
